text: Lynda Bird Johnson Robb (born March 19, 1944) is the elder of the two daughters of the 36th U.S. President Lyndon Baines Johnson and his First Lady Lady Bird Johnson. She was chairwoman of the Board of Reading is Fundamental, the nation's largest children's literacy organization, as well as chairwoman of the President's Advisory Committee for Women. She is a magazine editor who was First Lady of Virginia from 1982 to 1986, and as Second Lady of Virginia from 1978 to 1982. She is the oldest living child of a U.S. president, following the death of John Eisenhower on December 21, 2013. Johnson Robb is married to former United States Senator and Governor Chuck Robb. She was known to have dated actor George Hamilton when her father was president. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Children of Presidents of the United States Category:Lyndon B. Johnson Category:American autobiographers Category:American columnists Category:American editors Category:American philanthropists Category:Writers from Washington, D.C. title: Lynda Bird Johnson Robb
